etymologies: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to German Ding. Early senses included ‘meeting’ and ‘matter, concern’ as well as ‘inanimate object’

definitions: an object that one need not, cannot, or does not wish to give a specific name to

examples.text: look at that metal rail thing over there
there are lots of things I'd like to buy
she was wearing this pink thing

shortDefinitions: object that one need not, cannot, or does not wish to give specific name

definitions: personal belongings or clothing

examples.text: she began to unpack her things

shortDefinitions: personal belongings or clothing

definitions: equipment, utensils, or other objects used for a particular purpose

examples.text: they cleared away the lunch things

shortDefinitions: equipment or other objects used for particular purpose

definitions: anything (used for emphasis)

examples.text: she couldn't find a thing to wear

shortDefinitions: anything

definitions: used to express one's disapproval of or contempt for something

examples.text: you won't find me smoking those filthy things

shortDefinitions: used to express one's disapproval of or contempt for something

definitions: all that can be described in the specified way

examples.text: his love for all things Italian

shortDefinitions: all that can be described in specified way

definitions: used euphemistically to refer to a man's penis.
shortDefinitions: used euphemistically to refer to man's penis

definitions: an inanimate material object as distinct from a living sentient being

examples.text: I'm not a thing, not a work of art to be cherished

shortDefinitions: inanimate material object as distinct from living sentient being

definitions: a living creature or plant

examples.text: the sea is the primal source of all living things on earth

shortDefinitions: living creature or plant

definitions: used to express and give a reason for one's pity, affection, approval, or contempt for a person or animal

examples.text: have a nice weekend in the country, you lucky thing!
the lamb was a puny little thing

shortDefinitions: used to express one's feelings of pity, affection, approval

definitions: an action, activity, event, thought, or utterance

examples.text: she said the first thing that came into her head
the only thing I could do well was cook

shortDefinitions: action, event or utterance

definitions: circumstances, conditions, or matters that are unspecified

examples.text: things haven't gone entirely according to plan
how are things with you?

shortDefinitions: circumstances or matters that are unspecified

definitions: an abstract entity, quality, or concept

examples.text: mourning and depression are not the same thing
they had one thing in common—they were men of action

shortDefinitions: abstract entity or concept

definitions: an example or type of something

examples.text: the game is the latest thing in family fun

shortDefinitions: example or type of something

definitions: a situation or activity of a specified type or quality

examples.text: your being here is just a friendship thing, OK?

shortDefinitions: situation or activity of specified type or quality

definitions: a romantic or sexual relationship

examples.text: Phil and Lisa had been having a thing

shortDefinitions: relationship

definitions: an established or genuine phenomenon or practice (typically used in expressions registering surprise or incredulity)

examples.text: according to media reports, sleep texting is now a thing among serious smartphone addicts
he looks like he's wearing boxers underneath his trunks (is that a thing?)

shortDefinitions: established or genuine phenomenon or practice

definitions: what is needed or required

examples.text: you need a tonic—and here's just the thing

shortDefinitions: what is needed or required

definitions: what is socially acceptable or fashionable

examples.text: it wouldn't be quite the thing to go to a royal garden party in boots

shortDefinitions: what is socially acceptable or fashionable

definitions: one's special interest or concern

examples.text: reading isn't my thing

shortDefinitions: one's special interest or inclination

definitions: used to introduce or emphasize an important point

examples.text: the thing is, I am going to sell this house
here's the thing: this is a story, not a piece of hard news
that's the thing about style—no two people are completely alike

shortDefinitions: used to introduce or emphasize important point

phrases.text: be all things to all people
things that go bump in the night
